7QAVyBpK94aOGBl4qac01g.text: Uninspired and terribly slow service.  The table next to us, which arrived fifteen minutes after we ordered, received their good simultaneously.  The manager gets high marks for caring about our feedback.

pIlSJWmvyjuj-AWSnKbnZw.text: The concept was great, cooking the steak yourself at the table. The star however was our waitress. She was one of best I ever had anywhere. I only gave it 4 stars because English meat just isn't that good, but it is a fun place. Bring your kids or be a kid at heart.

-cmZGd0XI9S3LGbARNXNnA.text: Stick to the fillet.  My sirloin was bland.  The garlic bread was excellent.  Service was incredibly slow.  The price was reasonable.  Our waiter did his best bet the wait was ridiculous.

rnVlZ3DyQex2CnNTVj4WOw.text: I've been to Steak and Co. right before Christmas with my flat mate and we have had such a great dining experience! We wanted to have a girls catch up and dinner in central London, therefore we chose to be close to Leicester Square, and head to the cinema straight after dinner. My flat mate has chosen Chicken Alfredo, while I decided to order the new Steak Stone, a special steak that you can cook directly at your table. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and I felt like being Nigella for a night! Cooking my steak was a fun and quirky experience, loads of laughter involved. Clever idea, they give you a choice of flavoured butter and different sauces to dress your steak up. Prices absolutely reasonable and excellent choice of wines, venue decor and the central location are a big plus.

Kpp7WokzsjaNjIYLs8QQPQ.text: I had the opportunity to try a steak on a stone at London's Steak & Co. The meal was to put it bluntly, superb. The size of the steak and the presentation made a massive first impression. The steak came served as medium rare, but the unique thing about this meal is that you have the ability to cook the steak yourself using the hot stone which accompanies it. The taste of the steak was as good as i have ever tasted and even exceeded what i was expecting. The steak came with butter that added to the over all taste and experience of what i will remember as a perfect meal.

y66VjtCj6YqvhgOxu7Ws7w.text: Loved this restaurant, the sizzling steaks were the best, with creamy mushroom sauce and garlic butter. I could cook the steak just the way I like it and I could keep it hot all the way through my meal. Absolutely love it and will be going back soon.

fzrBqs2vjy53292UcsBIMg.text: The food was extraordinary good. By far the best steak i've ever had. When you go here (you should)  I'd recommend the fillet steak! Thanks Mario for the great service.

OcrDbe7b0dg6DuC-LhlCWA.text: My beef is with the Gloucester Road,  Steak and Co.Had the opportunity to have dinner here with my husband.  Had no problem with the food - except the small portion size (lamb - around 19,00 PS ) AND the 4 Pounds cover charge - 2 pounds per person!  For what exactly?  There was no live music or entertainment.  The waiter was nowhere to be found - I had to leave - I just hate it when establishments shamelessly eke out the last cent from their customers.  Disgusted.

X7s27lV1gJ5H5sKAXaxgpg.text: After a long day sipping ale in the sun and wandering along the South Bank we ended up in Leicester Square, hungry and in search of a substantial meal.After walking around the square we decided to settle for Steak & Co, on the corner of Charing Cross road.Having settled down outside (ah outdoor eating on a warm evening) we order a drink and started to browse the menu. My Captain Morgan & Coke came already coked and had a kick like a mule, they obviously were not shy with the Cap'n.  S_ had a diet coke which by all accounts was good and sugar free.I decided, as I was having a steak for main, to go for something lighter to start, and ended up selecting the mussels. What arrived was a paper bag in a dish, wrapped tightly, On opening the bad I found a decent portion of good sized mussels in a rich creamy garlic & onion sauce. The sauce was so good I ended up de-shelling all of the mussels into the sauce and eating it with a spoon like a soup.The mussels also came with 2 wet wipes and a spare bowl and napkins, the kind of touch so often missing. S_ had dipping skins, which was a good basket of crispy potato skins complete with garlic mayonnaise and jalapeño & sweet chilli dipping sauce. She was happy and we both chowed down, well pleased with the starter selection.When I ordered my 10 Oz Rib Eye, I was informed that it was served rare on a sizzling platter and I could complete the cooking to my liking. With the steak, you can order a seasoned salt, a butter and a sauce. The idea is that you season the steak when you get it, use the butter to fry off one piece at a time on the stone, and then use the sauce as a dip. I got the Chilli sea salt for seasoning, the garlic butter and the pepper sauce.Wow! When the steak arrived I promptly moved it form the stone to my plate, seasoned it with the salt, and then proceeded, piece by piece, to sear it on a small knob of garlic butter before diping it and popping each morsel in my mouth. The steak was juicy and tender, the sauce was good and tasted of black pepper, and the butter was obviously not tesco value brand. This method of eating a steak really works for me. The smell of the garlic butter sizzling and the steak searing before each mouthful really adds to the overall flavoursome sensation.With the steak I had a side of Fries and Onion rings, both excellent.S_ had a rack of ribs, which turned out to be  1/2 a large pig. The ribs were wide and juicy, and as she commented, "were not boiled" (a big bug bear with her). It certainly looked and smelled great. Again plenty of wet wipes and additional napkins were provided for the ribs. As our watier commented, this is where things get messy.Although quite satisfied, we decided to go for broke and ordered dessert.Her Rocky Road was an interesting concoction. Although it contained all of the usual ingredients of a Rocky Road, they were in layers instead of all being jumbled into one slab. An interesting take on a classic sweet snack and quite tasty. I had the Chocolate Fondant, a nicely sized rich slightly cakey exterior hiding a quite decadent thick warm gooey chocolate sauce. It was accompanied by a scoop of home-made vanilla ice cream bursting with grains of vanilla.Service was excellent and non-intrusive throughout. The waiter, while being alert and communicative left us alone while eating. When my steak was served, he hovered over me as I put the first tiny knob of butter on the stone, and immediately judged that the stone was not hot enough and whipped it away to be replaced with a lump of lava that stayed sizzling until I had cooked off the last morsel.What else can I say? Steak & Co ticks all the boxes for me and I will be re-visiting the next time I pop over for a show or a visit.

bUxrchoO7A-p_CtO2tIZRQ.text: A different approach for sure, but novelty is the best description.  Steaks arrive with a quick grill sear and are than finished at the table on a stone/cast iron brick to the diners preference.  The steak butters and sauces were quite good I personally would recommend the mustard seed.  The meats are quite good cuts, a little light on taste as most euro/British steaks seem to be.  Price is a bit high but in the end you are paying for the location more than anything else.

mYbBVkryy-PnKTdBhdNFuQ.text: It was a horrible evening. First of all - it was loud! Even though we asked kindly to reduce the loudness of the music nothing happened. Than there are rows of tables placed so unlucky that the service always hit me on my back. They serve the steak on a hot stone. The advise of the service to put some butter should prove to be as devastating! The fat injected, a lot of smoke and you smelled like you stayed the whole evening in the kitchen! The steak was grow through and tasteless! No, that was one of our worst restaurant visits ever!

a1tJjfGf_eUCf3ZxRxUOeQ.text: Nice enviroment Average steak, nothing impressive Sizzling experiance is great its a must atleast for one time Good varitey of options Some major mistakes from the waitress but he is well behaved and apolgized multiple times Weather you like it or not you must try it atleast once you will enjoy the experiance

m_zqDjtBLjO8-MfrgvmL6A.text: Steak was excellent and the service was good . Reasonable price too in the middle of London

Sf3OWGE0QSV4NIwCHT9kNg.text: This place was great. Katie our waitress was very attentive and everything was superb.

NmOjAZ6yEG2RgXCpam-mcQ.text: I am quite a steak lover and I just went back from Argentina where they do fantastic steak  so I was looking forward to this restaurant before I went there with my friend for dinner. I didnt know that we have to finish cooking on our own. I personally think the most important thing of cooking the steak is the time control and that is the thing is left to the customer himself which, in my understanding, means if you think the steak is not good its because you cooked it for too long on your own.  I dont know why people like it I just dont understand why am i paying that much money and just get the steak on the stone and you cook it yourself.

aja7ClVXSD2Xw5K8CqyOVA.text: For a place that's named Steak&Co. you'd expect that at least steakes will be well above average. That's not the case here. I wasn't amused with steak here, my wife tried Fish&Chips and wasn't happy as well. We stopped by hungry, left unsatisfied. Feels like it's the kind of place that is more about catching unwary, hungry tourists.

QSzRv7wIJw-VMCXM77PYyA.text: I was sceptical about going to this restaurant and I have to say this was mainly due to my hatred of Leicester Square and the fact that the majority of eateries here are extremely overpriced and commercial with poor service. I have to say.....I was pleasantly surprised. My friend had raved about the place as he works extremely close and had been twice before for lunch. When we went it was a few days before Christmas and it was our goodbye meal before the holidays! We enjoyed a lovely meal - he had ribs and chips and I had scampi and chips - and had some lovely wine. The service was great too. I would recommend the place and would return, wonderful location too - stone's thrown from the Portrait Gallery, off Charing Cross Road, walking distance to Charing Cross Station, Piccadilly and Leicester Square tube stations and Theatreland.

T6B7ZFySmNcxxV-OXdPJkw.text: I returned to Steak and Co. for lunch on a Saturday and I was sorely disappointed. First and foremost the side dishes were disgusting. The baked sweet potato was practically raw and inedible. The 'seasonal' vegetables tasted like they'd been taken out of the freezer and microwaved. The steak itself was also pretty horrible, and I normally love steak. The hot iron slab that it comes on continues to cook it whilst you're eating. It just tasted awful. My view of Leicester Square restaurants has returned - avoid at all costs.

QUeUAiuGUqLfI4rY_H1FzA.text: Came here with a large group a few weeks ago. The service was excellent and they had no problem filling our reservation. Everyone had steak in the group and we all really loved the food. We're Americans and we thought it was one of the best steaks we've ever had. They give you a choice of seasoning and flavored butter for your steak, served on a hot stone so you can cook to your desired temperature.Also, Mac & Cheese is DELICIOUS. Cheers for a great meal!

1g_eJueZgAflJwcCEmjvgg.text: After catching a show, we were famished for some good eats.  We stumbled upon Steak & Co. mostly because it was still open and serving food at 10:30pm.  The concept of this place is interesting.  You order your cut of steak, it's seared on both sides, and served it to you on a smoking hot plate.  The instructions were to place the steak on a side plate, cut up pieces of meat, and return them onto the hot plate with your choice of butter, salts, and sauce.  The idea is that you can then cook it to the done-ness of your choice and eat piece will be hot.  It reminded me a lot of Korean BBQ.  Although it was a little bit more labor intensive than I'd like for a steak dinner, the quality of the steak was amazing.  I ordered the filet with garlic butter, sea salt, and bernaise sauce.  I was very happy with my choices.  I like that since you're pretty much cooking the steak yourself, you can control the amount of butter and salt that's going into your food.  If you're with a group, try to order different butters, salts, and sauces so you can sample them all.We ordered chips, onion rings, and mashed potatoes for sides, and I would say that all of them were just ok.  Nothing great about any of them, which was a little disappointing.

GJBlCINaC_CHa1ieQmpY2w.text: The steak here is pretty delicious. It was also fun cooking your own meal. I don't like the configuration of the plate the steak comes on however. As a right-handed person, it was difficult to go back and forth over the stove to cut the steak.

eI5BIf-QF8sa9inYy4myDw.text: We were in London during the transit strike in May.  There are multiple Steak & Co. restaurants in London, and this is the only one where we dined.   We had walked all day and were exhausted and  were in the Leicester Square area.   I must eat gluten free, and my husband just wanted to eat, and he was in the mood for steak.  We asked if gluten free was available, and it was!   They even have a separate fryer for the French fries and other fried foods.We were not there for gourmet dining, but the steak, ribs, and seafood we had was quite good.  I loved the searing hot plate for the steak because you could eat it as you wished from rare to well done.  We returned for a second time later in our London visit before attending a play.  Both times the food was very good,  the waiters were very personable, and the food came in a reasonable amount of time.  We had no complaints.They also have free WiFi which was a nice plus.

OkJTZm2M4Zlal_j1etJUIg.text: Service was very good.  Food was good with interesting twist of having to cook your own steak to completion.

t_4ARWipALhDKPtun8E5gg.text: Overpriced and overcooked.I ordered the rump medium-well, and it came out overcooked--tough and dry. I had to hack through the beef and then drench it in sauce to make it palatable. Thankfully, the side tomatoes and potatoes were fine, although the special I ordered them. Had I ordered a standard dish, I would have only gotten the meat, and sides would have been an additional £2-3 on top of the £18 for the beef. Plus there's a £1 cover charge per person. Service was slow, disorganized, and inattentive--my water was never refilled, for example. Certainly there is better food to be had in Covent Garden.

oK75rWW_5n4u-30bdxaJtQ.text: A truly wonderful choice for meat eaters, and the perfect choice for those wanting a restaurant not surrounded by noisy children (there is no childrens menu for a reason!) I enjoyed a 10oz fillet steak which was divine-the meat arrives with a sizzling plate in the centre for you to cover the steak with your chosen butter and or sauce and finish off the cooking slice by slice-and the meat was simply perfect. I felt it was great value for money for such an excellent steak with a free bottle of chardonnay with theatre ticket receipts-but to pay extra for the side dishes seems somewhat excessive. the surroundings and decor are immaculate, toilets pristine, and there is a pleasant atmosphere. but as others have noted the evening service is slow (i had to remind the waiter to bring the wine as he forgot) and although I ordered ketchup twice it never arrived. The waiting staff had a slightly carefree attitude versus apologetic..(hence a star drooped on my review) but despite that i would definitely return again and would like to be able to restore that star on another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

Hxiry1TfSu22zhaeMZw9Dg.text: Fantastic restaurant in a great area in London.  Lots of work going on around there right now on the road and you would never know from the inside.  Excellent service, mushroom appetizer was amazing and plenty of reasonably priced menu options.  Very tasty, love the service - makes for unique experience.

gNRACLDb_OY5vdtiyQV5Hg.text: 2 friends and I stopped in here before a show on a casual Monday night. We were pleasantly surprised with how good the food was here. The restaurant is in the middle of a very touristy area but don't let that stop you from trying it. The three of us all got the "steak on a rock", where the meat comes out lightly seared and then you finish the cooking yourself on the hot stone. We chose the 8 oz filets. We each tried a different dipping sauce and butter and they were all delicious. TRY IT. It is a little messy, in terms of popping grease so be a little caustious when adding butter to the hot stone to cook your meat. Very good. I would return here if I am ever in London.

Q7J5MEun_fPBfzWqRc1SHQ.text: After several tours around the area, we spotted this restaurant close by the National Gallery. We smelled a delicious steak serves on a hot stone. We ordered the same, and we were not disappointed. The steak was served raw and you can cook the way you wanted it. The waiter reminded us not to overcook it. It was perfectly cooked and was tasty. The steak was served with salad and French fries. We also ordered salmon salad. Though it tasted a little salty, still a good meal. We were seated outside as the weather was perfect. The waiter was friendly and prices are reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Steak serves on a hot stone with salad and chips

Y3nXncrymP_GlGHE4mTXUg.text: Lovely atmosphere. Affordable price and enjoyable steak. Great wine list

xI5IMyu9U8L3qwgAw6Dpzw.text: My fellow Yelping girlfriend and I targeted Steak & Co for its supposedly great mac & cheese. I'M HERE TO WIPE "SUPPOSEDLY" FROM THAT SENTENCE.Before I get into that lemme just say that this is an amazing steak place, but THE SIDE DISHES. THE EFFING SIDE DISHES. I got a starter, the southern fried peppered chicken, and subsequently ordered three side dishes. BREAKDOWN TIME:Southern Fried Peppered Chicken Starter - Tastes like chicken tenders to me rather than fried chicken. Not that it's a bad thing at all, but after a few bites I got some ketchup to start dipping. So delicious. Friend fries - Thanks for calling these fries! I'm American so that hit home. The fries are presented in a cool way, it looks like a mini-frying basket. Perhaps they were in fact fried in that basket, but probably not. Refer to the pic I uploaded to see what I'm talking about.Caesar salad - I lovvvveee caesar salad so I got this for the hell of it and it was just as good as you'd expect a restaurant caesar to be.Mac and Cheese - OKAYYYYY HEREEEE WE GOOOO. I've been searching for the best mac and cheese in London for months, and we're staring down the barrel of a top candidate right here!!! It's the best I've had in London so far, and perhaps will remain at the top of my list for the rest of my time in this city! The noodles were doused in an ultra creamy pale cheese sauce. It was cooked to a crisp with its parmesan top layer. The inside was a white cheddar cheese sauce with double cream that was unlike any mac and cheese sauce I've ever tasted. It is one of the best I've ever had, definitely top 10 in my life. I'm so happy about finding it!!!PRICES: YOOOOO the prices for the sides were GREAT! All were about 3.50 or less! Which is a sharp contrast to the steak dishes which are 20 pounds or more. However all of the sides are quite affordable so you can order four or five and have that be your incredibly diverse meal! The starter I ordered was only about 8 pounds. These were definitely the cheapest things on the menu, but that's not why I chose them. They were AMAZING.The service was great as well. Very friendly server who gave us constant attention. However one of our party wanted her mac and cheese wrapped up and we were told they didn't have the license for that. Weird, didn't know there were laws about that. Especially in a place where people get such enormous portions.The place does not have wifi per say, but Wagamama is next door and their wifi fully envelopes the restaurant. So I signed into the cloud for free no sweat, and got fast internet while I was there!Every source says the underground stop closest to this place is Charing Cross, but I'm here to squash that thought. Leicester Square is much closer and is literally on the same block. Steak and Co is technically on Charing Cross Road, but that's not where the Underground stop dumps you off. Leicester Square puts you much closer.Anyways, GO HERE FOR THE MAC AND CHEESE AND LIVE THE REST OF YOUR LIFE IN HAPPINESS.------UPDATE-------After flipping out in that review you might be wondering why this now has four stars when it had five before. I've come here several more times since writing it and the food is still amazing, but the service at times is deplorable. It's some of the worst service I've had, the waiters are wayyyy understaffed and are literally running around the place. This often leads to extreme wait times for something as simple as tap water or ketchup. It's a damn shame because the food is incredible. The people I have gone with could not stand the service, nor could I. And I'm the one who spoke so highly of it! Come on guys.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Peppered beef starter.
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. There is no such thing as too much Mac & Cheese and fries.
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Mac & cheese YO!!!

YT6QHvx2hITko-6hm3QRVA.text: The Best Steak ever.  Loved the service there drinks and loved the way they represent the steak and let u finish cooking yourself.  Which we had this in the States.

tfuzbpR_Ac8OX5VWC-chtA.text: Wow what can I say apart from the best steak restaurant I have ever been in. It took about 30 mins to get a table, admittedly it was New Year's Eve and we hadn't booked!I had the rib eye and my wife and daughter had the fillet steak. They bring the steak out to the table seared, but still blue on the inside, and then you have a super hot block to cut you steak up on a cook to how you want it done. Quality of steak was amazing and their rustic chips were Devine.Little trick to remember if your going here, you can put your chips and other items on the hot rock as well to keep them hot whilst your waiting for your steak pieces to cook.Would I go back? Most definitely !!!

l2mGrZoeqDHPX2_HpxFhUQ.text: I waited for 10 minutes at steak & Co bar to get served as the staff said wait at the bar until she table is free...  After bar staff continued to avoid serving me I left and went elsewhere. I see the issue is that the management understaff the bar team which creates issues for customers who want to spend money while waiting.. It also means the bar doesn't run smoothly...

PTj2JPO7n9X6rKcW1fMJWw.text: What a magnificat Steak house. Uncomplicated service, manifold menu, great steaks of a high quality. What do you want more?

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Weihnachtessen. Da spielen Kalorien keine rolle ;)
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Rump Steak with vegetables, sweetpotato chips and Chili Butter

1-n2TfRM3aUHqUSzQ_Cj1A.text: After having a few ho hum meals here in London I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Very simple premise which we don't have in LA but that I think would work very well if people would take extra care and not burn themselves and sue the restaurant because Americans are so sue happy. At Steak & Co. You a nice sized steak (8oz or 10z) in different cuts (rib eye, sirloin, filet), pick a butter, a rub and a sauce. It gets served to you cooked seared rare with a good sized hot stone and you cut & cook your meat the remainder of the meal yourself. Genuis! I ordered filet with garlic butter, salt & pepper rub and bearnaise and the meat was super tender. The Mac & cheese was good, Cesar salad was a bit overdressed and soggy and the chips and onion rings, excellent. I'm so happy to have found great tasting steak in London. Yay!

61avQI1Hdj2DVofJB0EuqA.text: Spacious sitting room, quick service.  They have lunch and theater specials for £8.  I ordered the salmon and asparagus salad and it was good size.  Just a drizzle of dressing. Salmon is v salty but I enjoyed it.

KS6Ne8AIUonzi5Fy-m1lJQ.text: I burnt myself here without any notice of heated handle on the plate. And the servant even wanted to charge me for the meal, I only ordered Caeser salad and shrimps, they are really awful and I had a huge scar in my arm, feeling painful and depressing. The worst experience I have ever had in my life! Will never go back to this tourist trap.

ht0pYyhp-uCr6qTZEpgBWg.text: Decent quality steak, sides were very good except for the onion rings which had a pretty bland batter.  Take the steak off the stone immediately unless you want shoe leather.

4ueVPpZ2tXDNzXb4QRAfzA.text: What a wonderful restaurant. Best steak I have eaten . . . Anywhere in our vast travels in world. Great service too!

GHwD1Z4A0-ZWZ7ujqcEs9w.text: And I did it again!Guess what, it was awesome as last week!!! You really should go here, eat a large steak, drink a pint or two, and then continue your touristy tour...

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

uwsuqasg8i52tQJVzORQ3g.text: We actually dined at the Haymarket location and loved the concept.  Interactive dining with teens was such a plus...kept them off their phones and engaged as a family.  Food was excellent, too.  Quote from teen daughter "OMG, it was so good.  Can we go there again tonight?"

44D2whWuzYAvC8_zmrh8hw.text: Great steak at a great price in a location that  doesnt have to be either was quite refreshing.  Never had a meal as good in the centre of what i consider the uber-tourist area of London.  Pick your steak, pick your sauce and accompanyments and away you go.While the idea of cooking your steak at your table is quite a unique idea, it was wasted on us as someone who likes their steak rare, all your left with is a big slab of ultra-hot granite, over-cooking your steak which means your left trying to eat it as quick as you can to prevent it becoming over-cooked.The other downside to the place is that is just soooo busy and i think they have tried to counter this by cramming even more people in.  Your sat on the shoulders of the person next to you and it would be easier to eat if they cut and fed you your meal and you did likewise for them.But overall it doesnt detract from what is a damn fine meal at a bargain price in a part of London that usually is only good for passing through.

Z7CBxKTTsiVAm0pGzjjoaw.text: I've been here about 3 or 4 times and never leave disappointed. This place actually got me to like steak the first time I went. The fishcakes are a bit dry but the rest of the food and service is great! It is a lot to get through - definitely somewhere to go on an empty stomach!Their lunch menu is also very good for a quick bite - 4 oz steak, chips & Salad for £10-15.I went once when it was quite busy though and was sat inside at the back - ended up leaving smelling like a bbq/bombfire.

MkuVD5wFJaHE_pQ1HHectA.text: I realize that if you have to cook your own meat...why?  Well the price, meat, sides are all amazing.  And cooking to the exact way you want.  Hot off the rock...well spectacular.  If you are in Soho...then make your way to Steak&co.  Good wine prices.

FGISAtNDkP42k-xKVSBQlA.text: I'm from Texas. I know steak. This was by far one of the best steak experiences I've ever had, especially for the price. Excellent service, unique environment, and outstanding food. Visiting London only but I could see how this would be a staple for locals. Great food, good wine a drinks, and all without breaking the bank.

3VffXXwkobrHjN9998PslA.text: Wow, I am already looking forward to the next time I come to Steak & Co (easily within the next few days). The food was INCREDIBLE. The ribs were to live for; the meat fell right off the bone and the BBQ sauce was so delicious. I cannot stress this enough: GET THE MACARONI AND CHEESE SIDE DISH. My boyfriend and I have been on a mission to find the best macaroni and cheese in London, and I have to say, this may be some of the best in the world. The food was served quickly and the waiters were very friendly. The restaurant's atmosphere was very nice, classy decor. The place smelled intensely of steak immediately upon entering (which shouldn't be surprising for a place called Steak & Co). I didn't get the steak but it looked amazing both on the menu and on the tables of customers around us. There are about a dozen different butters to choose from to get with the steak you choose (six choices I think). Weird thing: you can't take your unfinished food to go! Something about "licensing?" So make sure you finish your food and enjoy it!Overall great place. Super, super delicious.

Uk6Vn53tbg2Lf67HdQnoOw.text: First, we were seated outside looking into the sun on one of the hottest days in London. Then the waitress, Katie, was quite aggravated when I couldn't understand her accent about how I was supposed to cook my own steak.  Almost condescending.  When I didn't move my steak fast enough to the plate from the hot stone  because it was sticking to  per her instructions she was very impatient and rude. We ran out of water.  And the food was underwhelming. I don't think they realize this is a tourist destination in theater district.  And if their servers are snobby to tourists then they shouldn't work here.  Hostess and host were very pleasant.  Proseco rose was good too.  When I'm paying $30 for a filet I don't want to prepare it.  We should have ordered something else.

cT6dNe7J3QkIb0h1ClVPMA.text: Not sure about the steak but the bucket of muscles is #foodgasm. I took my newly vegetarian mom here because it was close and i was hungry. We both aren't really steak people. The bucket of muscles (which says "to share") is great for an individual. The sauce isn't quite as tangy as I have had it in Italian restaurants but was still light and creamy. Also, the muscles weren't smelly, fishy or ocean tasting which was great. Sometimes you get muscles that still have grit in them, not at this place. We got a side of garlic bread to dip the sauce and their sauvignon blanc. Overall, a good experience. Though, they may want to be more attentive to customers as it took a lot of time and effort trying to flag someone down to give us water and lemon wedges.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Bucket of muscles and garlic bread

rdSUuofGkknBC4Tv6_Aemw.text: So my family and I were in London before Christmas and literally stumbled upon Steak & Co by accident, because we were really hungry and were looking for a Ramen place, but my son read Lunch Special outside, so we entered. And we're really glad we did! I was a little intimidated at first because it looked a little pricey, but like I said, it exceeded our expectations. If I recall correctly their Lunch specials were less than $10 euros, although the regular menu, is a bit more expensive. Anyways, I had an amazing and delicious steak served on a hot stone with a side a fries (I think the steak was like $12, but totally worth it), my wife had a salmon salad, which she said was delicious and my son had fish  from the kids menu (which was also reasonably priced) which he also loved! The food quality was top notch and so was the service. Would definitely return on our next trip to London

zV4h9ezAUifNoPcx8riI-Q.text: Great atmosphere, if you want a busy, energetic buzz.  Food was disappointing.  I didn't go steak, but chicken and pasta.  Chicken was tough and pasta over cooked.  I won't rush back

EYhUN4CftPRkpFNDfISqaA.text: AMAZING STEAK This must be one one of the best places for steak in London. Great service, great concept, great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Halal steak

jYuLBfR8fkb8dOPw29yjiw.text: I wish they had half stars, because I would have given 4.5. This place was great! My favorite meal of my trip to London! My son's steak (ribeye) was excellent, as were my ribs. The melting Camembert was heavenly, and so clever! The wine-by-the glass prices and portions are great! Definitely come here! It's in the heart of everything and lots of people-watching to be had. They are also very flexible with their closing time, which was appreciated. We came late on a Friday night (still here writing this at 12:20am!) and never felt rushed. Thank you, Lucia, for the attentive service!

5IM47IwXzSqXP0BKo-9IsQ.text: Unlike any other traditional steak house, this place actually brings your choice of steak out with a hot stone and 3 ingredients of your choice to cook the meat to your ideal rawness.I had the rib eye with sea salt, butter and red wine sauce. The waitress recommend this combo so that I could really taste the flavor of the steak instead of just drowning it in the sauce and I glad I listened to her.Definitely would go back, one of the best steaks I've ever had.

03HzZX4X9Rx7VLCGgDr9jw.text: Came in completely on a whim before enjoying West End theatre, and was absolutely delighted by the attentive and helpful service and delicious meal.  Filet was lightly marbled and well flavored on its own as a delightful steak.  Cooking on the hot stone slowed down the meal enough to let in conversation and to make sure each bite was to my exact specifications.  The potato gratin side, ice cream dessert, and good espresso all topped off a top notch experience. Come and bring anyone who would enjoy a slow, tasty meal designed to be shared.

qhU3e2qklLW4jFlpmoL9qA.text: Came here whilst visiting London. After we sat down we were ignored for at least 20 minutes. We decided to leave and on the way out, spoke to the manager about our wait. She was great and really apologetic and even offered us a free meal if we stayed! We did stay and enjoyed the food, but, then the 'actual' manager came up to us and apologised for our wait and then said she'd be happy to give us a free.....desert. We had actually decided to pay for our meal in the end because of the great service received by the first lady. This other manager had obviously been told about our free meal offer and had come over to us to reset our expectations. This is why they get a one star review. If they had not tried to go back on their offer, we would have paid anyway and they would be getting a great review. Just shows the corporate side of the business where customers are just $$$$$$

wOkk7KK_dKzWM10kdz9nOQ.text: I thought the concept of cooking your own steak was kind of silly, maybe I'm just not that great a cook, but I never got my steak the way I wanted it. Plus our glasses was really dirty so we had to ask for new ones. However, the food was good and the ambiance of the place was great. Service was good also, so I'm giving it 4 stars, though I would have given 3,5 if I could.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

Qj0VrSSj80dBQHhiaovovw.text: Steak served on a piping hot slate that YOU cook to perfection = amazing! I've never tasted such succulent, tasty, mouthwatering steak at such a decent price. So here's the concept - all the steak arrives rare on the cooking slate, you then put the steak on your plate and cook it further (if you wish) as you eat it (by returning it to the cooking slate). You also choose 3 different flavourings to accompany your steak; a butter, flavoured salt and sauce (I went for garlic butter, chilli salt and mushroom sauce - there are so many options to choose from). The side dishes were also fantastic - onion rings, mash, coleslaw. Again lots of choice here. There was no room for dessert unfortunately (but definitely next time ). I'd say come hungry to eat here as the portions are very generous.  The staff are lovely and friendly too. Wonderful restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Cook your own steak at the table

EMCzNKj_UyrFmPtoGTns9w.text: Nice Steak restaurant, great for friend to get together. We have lamb, sirloin and pork rib, and I have to say that pork rib is much better than I expect.

JoRzQJTvvWbi6AOO7658og.text: Never disappoints. It's a must visit when in London. Served on a hot stone, your steak is cooked to perfection... Delivered to you with amazing yummy sides - Fillet steak, garlic butter & rustic fries! Surroundings are lovely, we sat outside, enjoyed people watching & was given steak & go blankets for when it got a little chilly. Staff were extremely friendly & very accommodating. Honestly - if you're ever in London, please visit. You won't be disappointed. P.s - garlic bread starter with cheese, mouth watering at the though!!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Fillet steak, garlic butter, peppercorn sauce & rustic fries... YUM!!!

ybCqk1kCgoHzRBrCJeJ0ww.text: I loved the set up. They bring out the meat on a hot stone  plate so that if the meat is too rare for your tasting, you can cook it a bit more to make it well done. I got the sirloin steak (8 oz) with sea salt and chili flakes. The mushroom sauce is my absolute fave and would definitely recommend it as it compliments the steak so well. Service is good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. 8 oz sirloin steak, sea salt and chili flakes, garlic butter, mushroom sauce

9HRX_I4Wy3QLl0i9nA32dg.text: Ever want to cook your steak a little more, but not send it back to the kitchen? Or warm the last few pieces up? Steak & Co serves their steaks cooked a perfect rare on a blazing block of iron and you let it cook to the perfect color at your table. And the block stayed very hot throughout dinner, so I could heat up the last few strips of my 10oz. boneless ribeye and savor the seared flavor.Along with a nicely aged steak, they offer a choice of seasoned salt, seasoned butter and sauce to go with your steak choice. Add excellent chips (steak fries) and my friend and I had a meal with a lot of different tastes and textures. Our appetizer portion of barbecue chicken wings and the garlic bread with cheese were also a highlight. The other appetizers we sampled were good but nothing out of the ordinary. All the servers were very attentive. Dishes were cleared promptly and we received new silverware for our entree. And a special thank you to Abbie the hostess, who was the loveliest person I met in London. Definitely try it out if you want a great steak experience in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Great steak experience in Piccadilly Circus in London.

BeKJO0FT98NxUbtMXLqI3A.text: OK I'll be honest, it was last month that I came here - but I have been dreaming of it ever since! I'm embarrassingly fussy with meat, especially steak, but every mouthful of this was absolute perfection and I'm almost scared to go back in case it doesn't live up to the first time!It loses a star for the wait time - their system for giving out tables didn't seem particularly organised and it took quite some time for our table of three to get seated, but I must say that the annoyance from that experience soon vanished once the food came. Choose your type of steak, then choose your butter (garlic all the way!), rub/ seasoning (chili salt for me) then your sauce (Bearnaise pretty please) - the steak comes raw, with your own hot stone to cook your meat EXACTLY to your liking. And the fillet steak was GOOD!! The sides were ok too, we all sort of shared fries, onion rings and seasonal veg. But the steak... OH the steak!I'm salivating.I would recommend heading somewhere else for dessert - the chocolate fudge cake type thing we got was a bit disappointing. But go for the steak.Seriously.Steak.

fny0kbtBvycq0ukyTWGL6g.text: The place is very well located.I went there on a Sunday and they had a sunday special menu with a special plate with steak.The steaks were the smallest order I ever had in a meal in my entire life, plus, the idea of the hot iron is not good, women in general get very mad about the smell going into their clothes.SO DONT GET THIS SPECIAL ON SUNDAY, the steak one.BUT, all other steaks on the menu looked very very good, I would go back because the place is great, the service is great and the menu also, but I would definitely order something else.

I9_j6s_Wo240SF2p__ibIg.text: Steak & Co can be summed up with one saying "Nice idea, shame about the execution". The setting, the staff and the menu seem nice but when it comes down to the actual details there is much fine-tuning to be done. I noticed 4 "cardinal sins". Firstly, the table for 2 is so small it is somewhat uncomfortable to even cut your steak as your elbows have no space to rest and when people on the tables next to you get up to go to the toilet or leave they are bound to invade your space or knock your elbows somewhat. There is limited space to even place the food and drink. Secondly, seeing as steak is supposed to be its speciality, the steak I had was decidedly unremarkable and probably below par compared to other steak restaurants as I found it rather tough and tasteless apart from the layer of pepper on top. Thirdly, the "seasonal vegetables" I had included carrots that were either over-boiled or dry to begin with, such that they had a sleet of white colour, plus there was no dressing or taste added to the vegetables. Fourthly, the waiter does not provide or ask to provide any sauce when serving fries which forces you to request it especially.What saves this dining experience is that the garlic mushrooms and mash potato sides are very nice, the menu has a good variety and it serves halal steak, and the opportunity to season and watch your steak sizzle in front of you is a nice feature also. Thus all in all, a "nice idea, just shame about the overall execution".

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Garlic mushrooms side, pepper steak, sea salt, garlic butter and pepper sauce
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Mashed potato, garlic mushrooms, pepper steak
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Fries, seasonal vegetables, garlic mushrooms and mashed potato sides

3BCMJHxP4vRAmAh6geeM1A.text: Returned here today since the whole steak cooking novelty was very well liked by my kids... The ribeye was fantastic, this time I went with the chili salt (which we never got on our first visit even though it was ordered) the chile butter and the red wine sauce. I also ordered the Mac and cheese based on the other yelp reviews... Can't say that I would order it again though. It was a white sauce with some form of very sharp white cheddar melted on top. It wasn't bad but definitely not what I was hoping for. The sweet potato fries came through though! They were sweet salty deliciousness! Oh and they have a kids menu! I can't believe we weren't even offered the kids menu the first time we came. My youngest got a burger and fries that she enjoyed. We ordered the sticky toffee pudding for dessert... It was a rather small portion for the price but it tasted lovely.

mJmqT0jOorwkJ8j4gW71RQ.text: This place is decent, but somehow I don't have a deep impression of it. Like the steak was nice, but it didn't keep me wanting more. Maybe just me though, and despite that I would still give it 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

8LdehrsxjBmpasW1pm1PGw.text: I was in London for a conference and I met a friend for dinner. He brought me here for the steak and the experience. The restaurant was busy, but we only had a short wait for a table (while getting a drink at the bar). My filet was delicious and the experience of choosing the salt, sauce and butter was fun. We had chips and steak fries, and my friend had the calamari before his steak (which it seems he's had many times before). All in all it was a fun and tasty dinner.

GB7Z6h4wwLcVA4vxTjIbcw.text: Good food.Absolutely the worst service I have ever had. Don't bother. Walk to the next restaurant.

MRK7sY6EZs858P-1TTFKDw.text: Staff was nice and presentation was pretty but none of our meat order came cooked as requested. We were crammed into our table in the back corner and staff and other guests had difficulty getting around us. In addition the music was extremely loud and we had a hard time hearing each other talk. (As a point of reference I'm in my 40's and my hearing is just fine.).

HfHbxjDvS3PBtQIAZpqdhg.text: Came in hungry... 90 minutes later still hungry.An hour till I got my steak. Asked for a medium got it burned on one side, like it waited 10 minutes on the shelve for pick up. Told the waiter, got a new one. The second was even worse!Cut it in half and it was 80% cold where in the center it was nearly frozen!Needless to add that there item that I've ordered was the "famous fillet".Not recommend at all.

7UktXG2Dgq2w3XImK1XrPw.text: Very cool steak place.  The key is they serve you a rare cooked steak and give you a hot rock to cook it on.  The steaks are good but the idea of butter salt and sauce on a hot steak as you want it.  Amazing. I loved the idea and taste was very good. Prices are ok and the service is really fast a good place when near traflagar square.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

htTXA_Xm6RseISKc04WXSQ.text: My wife, my baby and me ended sweating all the night after eating here. Next morning all 3 of us threw up. The most unpleasent experiencia eating meat I've ever had. I am argnetinian and know well how meat must be served. It was raw, and you hace to cook it on a stone. Meat must be cooked to kill bacterias, THIS! place is the worst place I ve eaten in my life. I will go now to get my money back. This was a scam.

BI_KOk6fHI_VbvYXx7Y80A.text: This place was an amazing find!!! Hands down one of the best filets ever!! The best part is you choose your butter, seasoning and then sauce. It comes out on this sizzling hot stone at rare. You then take the steak off, dab the butter on your stone then slice the steak and cook to your preference!! The potatoes au gratin made the perfect side! #happyandfedinLondon

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

1idoXLByRymB-c697vZYdw.text: The concept is not entirely new.  Steaks have been served on a sizzling platter for ages and cook-your-own-food places like KBBQ have been popular for decades.  But this is different and comes with a twist.  Here's how it works:1.  First choose a steak: Filet mignon, rib eye, sirloin, etc.2.  Choose a butter to cook your steak with: Garlic, Chili, Parsley or whole grain mustard.3.  Choose a seasoning (shake): sea salt, seaweed, mustard, or paprika.4.  Choose a sauce: Béarnaise, mushroom, red wine, or pepper.Your steak is then delivered to you seared on the outside to seal in the flavor, but completely rare inside.  It is served on a hot stone which remains sizzling hot for over an hour.  I recommend that you remove the steak from the hot stone immediately and place it on your plate to avoid overcooking your steak.You'll then slice your steak to your desired thickness and then cook the slices on the hot stone to your personal preference:Place some butter on the hot stone, let it bubble for a moment and add your slice of steak to the stone. Sprinkle with your choice of seasoning.  When your steak is almost ready, spoon some sauce over it and let it sizzle.  Then enjoy your perfect creation.Repeat.  Repeat.  Repeat until the entire steak is gone.TIP:  Order a side of mushrooms so you can have your steak with your own personal sautéed mushrooms!  Moreover, every item like veggies or potatoes can be placed on your hot stone and "grilled".  Every bite is "fresh from the grill".  Your food is never cold.The quality of the meat was top notch.  The filet mignon was tender and flavorful.  We also tried a pepper steak which was a filet crusted with black peppercorns that gave me the extra kick in flavor that I was looking for.The place was cool and vibrant.  The atmosphere was casual and lively.  Service was good and efficient given how packed and busy the place was.  It is not the typical steak house experience. It's almost like an adventure.If you love a good steak cooked to your personal perfection and happen to find yourself in the streets of London, I highly recommend that you stop by Steak and Co. and enjoy a different and refreshing rendition of a culinary experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

dee5NhxautkeFwnPQD0IAQ.text: Horrible experience. You have to cook your own steak on a hot stone that colds down quickly.  All the time you worry about having to eat raw meat in the end.  Why do they need chefs if you cook your own?  This is a supermarket that sells raw meat, not a resaturant.  The waiter recommends an expensive red wine that taste like sh@t.  BAD experience.  Do NOT go there.

QgXCNIs4sS9ebE-WSqVYSw.text: I really recommend the sirloin steak...! Still has some fat but not too much, and very flavorful! It's a fun idea to 'cook' your own steak to your own taste but be aware that some oil might get on your clothes

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. Sirloin steak, salad, and sweet potato fries

UwdNmP1YmfDifRxi9EG7zg.text: Wow a meal we will not forget! We came here for our anniversary and both got the filet. The steak was AMAZING and the whole experience was unforgettable. Reasonably priced as well and great service. You HAVE to come here if in London.

QngmrThm2TmIpkuqWCZXGw.text: Food was good, but then, we cooked it ourselves.  Overall, it was an okay meal, the side dishes were tasty -- Probably would have scored the meal higher but we were seated prior to all the tables around us, yet all of those tables are before us. It seems the waiter forgot to put the ticket in...  The waiter was a nice guy, but my wife caught the manager staring at our table repeatedly and finally pulled the waiter aside, then the waiter was at our table telling us it'd only be a few minutes... Again, we cooked it ourselves...

9dPlK7E_MG35x22FNqEBhw.text: We were greeted and seated promptly by the waitress. She gave us a demo on how to cook the meat on the hot sizzling stone to our liking. Maddie is her name.The only awkward thing was their manager or the mater die. He kept pacing back and forth throughout the restaurant. This bothered me cause he made me uneasy hovering over people instead of just helping out the crew. The waitresses were friendly but this guy had a stern and stoic look on his face. He does not look approachable.Food:Chicken Alfredo-I found it bland. The sauce and presentation were decent but it lacked the flavor that I am used to in restaurants served by the same dish in the states. Wished they added some parmesan cheese on it.Sirloin steak-Served in a sizzling hot stone. Comes in rare by default so you can grill it to your liking in the stone. U get a choice of seasoning and sauce. Butter is used as a oil base for grilling the steak.I found the steak tough. We did not grill the meat until its well done. Therefore, it is the meat that is tough.Chocolate sundae-Really good. Brownie burried under vanilla ice cream and crunchy chocolate bits.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. brownie sundae-single serving (good for 2 people)

jnQ29sMW9IVWZiQ33vMvgQ.text: Awesome meal!  Had the appetizer plate which included chicken wings, ribs, corn, potato skins, etc.  for the main course I had the filet (house special).  Was super yummy.  Service was excellent.  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

x1sGES3S-qdljPywKczJUw.text: OMG this steak is amazing.  We went twice while in London.  Very great value, first night I had a filet and it was 20£ which is really only about 25$ for an 8 oz, Argentinian grass fed cut.  Same cut would easily be $40 at Ruth's Chris or Morton's, maybe more.  Had the jacket potato and veggies as well as a bottle of their featured wine and an aperitivo.  They barely seat both sides and serve it rare but it's on a sizzling cast iron stone that is red hot so you can cut your pieces and grill them to your desired doneness, that may not be for everyone but i loved it.  Pro tip; throw your veggies and potato on the stone as well to get a nice crunch on the skins.  Also cut your pieces a few at a time and seat them ahead of taking your bite, toss the butter and the seasoning on as well to carmelize your meat.  I had the garlic butter and salt and Chili flake.  I'd recommend to tourists and city residents alike.  I'd give a shout out to the waiters but none introduced themselves.   They were very friendly tho and prompt.

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

10ewHyVfj2JFAPPW5bIVZQ.text: You need to DIY your steak basically, which brings more fun to your dinner by customizing your favor. I would recommend the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom. DIY your steak.
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

AxEasuZT-ObYB97rvl0RDA.text: GreatLoved it superThis the BEST steak place ever!!! Very cool with 'cook it to your liking' hot stone!  I promise, if you like steak, you'll love this place!!

3dOcfGzEyqgKmPjhc12BMw.text: Casual and friendly place for steaks -- we left feeling full and happy. The steaks were generally good -- we ordered a rump and a ribeye, and both were very tender and served in great portions. Absolutely enjoyed their concept of grilling your own steak on a hot stone! It was a whole new steak experience. AMAZING service by all staff members. We particularly enjoyed being served by our waiter, who was prompt and very kind. He anticipated every need of ours and brought them even without asking. I would go back just for his services! Ambience was quite good as well. Very decent but not too posh or straight laced. Reminded me of a more casual version of Hawksmoor. Ideal for any type of family or social meals. Overall, would definitely recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Steak & Co. - London, United Kingdom

TgMG1TEHgxC0IDIqVOu4bg.text: Very nice place. The mussel dish was flavorful and creamy. I was impressed with the quality and the reasonable price. The rib eye I ordered was not the best, little chewy but still fine.

DidDLYs7p2i67kMZ9PugdQ.text: Best meal I had in London after a week of traveling.  Loved the atmosphere and service. I will eat here again on my next visit.
